com.mesosphere.sdk.config

Class ConfigValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.config.ConfigValue

  • public class ConfigValue
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper around a string value, providing convenience functions for converting the string to various types.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConfigValue(java.lang.String debugName, java.lang.String value)
      Creates a new configuration value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o) 
      int hashCode() 
      boolean optionalBoolean(boolean defaultValue)
      Returns the wrapped value as a boolean, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.
      double optionalDouble(double defaultValue)
      Returns the wrapped value as a double, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.
      int optionalInt(int defaultValue)
      Returns the wrapped value as an int, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.

      Returns the wrapped value as a long, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.

      Returns the wrapped value as a String, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.

      Returns the wrapped value as a boolean.

      Returns the wrapped value as a long.

      Returns the wrapped value as a String.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a debug string describing the string value and the original envvar name that it came from.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigValue

        public ConfigValue(java.lang.String debugName,
                   java.lang.String value)
        Creates a new configuration value.
        Parameters:
        debugName - debug label describing the origin of this value (e.g. the full originating environment variable with any prefixes)
        value - the value to be interpreted, or null if the value isn't available/set

    • Method Detail

      • requiredString

        public java.lang.String requiredString()
        Returns the wrapped value as a String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is missing

      • requiredBoolean

        public boolean requiredBoolean()
        Returns the wrapped value as a boolean. Mapping logic is as follows: - t[rue]/T[RUE]/y[es]/Y[ES]/1 => true - all others (including empty string) => false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is missing

      • requiredInt

        public int requiredInt()
        Returns the wrapped value as an int.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is missing
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as an int

      • requiredLong

        public long requiredLong()
        Returns the wrapped value as a long.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is missing
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as a long

      • requiredDouble

        public double requiredDouble()
        Returns the wrapped value as a double.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the value is missing
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as a double

      • optionalString

        public java.lang.String optionalString(java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns the wrapped value as a String, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.

      • optionalBoolean

        public boolean optionalBoolean(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the wrapped value as a boolean, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing. Mapping logic is as follows: - t[rue]/T[RUE]/y[es]/Y[ES]/1 => true - all others (including empty string) => false

      • optionalInt

        public int optionalInt(int defaultValue)
        Returns the wrapped value as an int, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as an int

      • optionalLong

        public long optionalLong(long defaultValue)
        Returns the wrapped value as a long, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as a long

      • optionalDouble

        public double optionalDouble(double defaultValue)
        Returns the wrapped value as a double, or returns the provided defaultValue if the value is missing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the value could not be parsed as a double
